TI LATERAL SCALING INVESTIGATION ON DC AND RF PERFORMANCES OF INP/INGAAS
   HETEROJUNCTION BIPOLAR-TRANSISTORS
SO IEICE TRANSACTIONS ON ELECTRONICS
LA English
DT Article
DE INP; INGAAS; HBT; HIGH-SPEED; LOW-POWER
AB Self-aligned InP/InGaAs heterojunction bipolar transistors (HBTs) were fabricated with emitter electrodes of 1 X 2, 2 X 2, 2 X 5, and 2 x 20 mu m(2) on the same wafer to investigate the influence of lateral scaling on device performance. DC characterization of these devices showed that InP/InGaAs HBTs are less subject to the emitter-size effect than GaAs-based HBTs. Common-emitter current gain a of the smallest 1 X 2-mu m(2) transistor was approximately 60 which is high enough for practical use. High-frequency characteristics of the transistors were almost the same in spite of the Large difference in device size. Unity current-gain cutoff frequency f(T) of the smallest 1 X 2-mu m(2) transistor was as high as 163 GHz at a collector current of 2.3 mA, which ranks with the f(T)=176 GHz achieved by the largest 2 X 20-mu m(2) transistor at a collector current of 45 mA. The smallest device also showed an excellent high-speed performance of f(T) greater than or equal to 100 GHz at submilliampere collector currents of I-c greater than or equal to 0.6 mA. The results indicate that small-lateral-dimension InP/ InGaAs HBTs are applicable to high-speed ICs with low power dissipation.
C1 NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,LSI LABS,ATSUGI,KANAGAWA 24301,JAPAN.

AU KURISHIMA, K

AF KURISHIMA, K
   NAKAJIMA, H

TI EFFECTS OF A COMPOSITIONALLY-GRADED INXGA1-XAS BASE IN ABRUPT-EMITTER
   INP/INGAAS HETEROJUNCTION BIPOLAR-TRANSISTORS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 1994 International Conference on Solid State Devices and Materials (SSDM
   94)
CY AUG 23-26, 1994
CL YOKOHAMA, JAPAN
SP Japan Soc Appl Phys
DE INP; INGAAS; HBT; GRADED BASE; BUILT-IN FIELD; NONEQUILIBRIUM TRANSPORT
ID ELECTRON-TRANSPORT; QUANTUM-WELLS; THICKNESS; HBTS; ZN
AB A compositionally-graded InxGa1-xAs base is experimentally shown to improve electron transport properties in abrupt-emitter InP/InGaAs heterojunction bipolar transistors (HBTs). The built-infield in the base of 6 kV/cm enables a more than 50% improvement in current gains, compared to a uniform-base structure. The peak current-gain cutoff frequency f(T) for the graded-base HBT is 143 GHz versus 121 GHz for the uniform-base HBT. It is also shown that the graded-base structure is effective in suppressing the space charge in the vicinity of the base-collector junction. The built-in field in the base accelerates low-speed energy-relaxed electrons and thereby increases the velocity of electrons injected into the collector. The minimized base widening effect, combined with low base resistance, yields a maximum oscillation frequency f(max) over 2 00 GHz even at a collector bias voltage V-CE as low as 1 V.
RP KURISHIMA, K (reprint author), NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,LSI LABS,3-1 MORINOSATO WAKAMIYA,ATSUGI,KANAGAWA 24301,JAPAN.

TI MAGNETIC PHASE-TRANSITION OF ORGANIC RADICAL MAGNETS
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Magnetism - ICM 94 (13th IUPAP Triennial
   Conference on Magnetism)
CY AUG 22-26, 1994
CL WARSAW, POLAND
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS
AB Antiferromagnetism of quasi-one-dimensional organic/molecular ferromagnets MOTMP and MATMP and an antiferromagnet AOTMP are studied by susceptibility measurements. The ordered states are well described as an typical antiferromagnet with uniaxial anisotropy. Weak ferromagnetic behavior is also observed in MATMP and AOTMP along the direction of the spin easy axis.

TI CURRENT STATUS OF DEVELOPMENT OF DEMONSTRATION FAST BREEDER REACTOR AND
   PROSPECT OF FBR COMMERCIALIZATION
SO JOURNAL OF THE ATOMIC ENERGY SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA Japanese
DT Article
DE DEMONSTRATION PLANTS; FBR TYPE REACTOR; REACTOR CORE; NUCLEAR FUELS;
   REACTOR SAFETY; PRIMARY SYSTEM; THERMAL HYDRAULICS; STRUCTURE; REACTOR
   MATERIALS; INNOVATIVE TECHNOLOGY; COMMERCIALIZATION
AB The Demonstration Fast Breeder Reactor (DFBR) is the next step of FBR development following the prototype fast breeder reactor ''MONJU''. The DFBR is now under development by The Japan Atomic Power Co. (JAPC) under the sponsorship of 9 Japanese electric power companies and Electric Power Development Co., Ltd.
   The JAPC has been performing the design study and R & D for DFBR in cooperation with Power Reactor and Nuclear Fuel Development Corp. (PNC), Central Research Institute of Electric Power Industry (CRIEPI) and Japan Atomic Energy Research Institute (JAERI).
   This report describes the prospect of FBR commercialization and the current status of new technology for DFBR and innovative technology toward FBR commercialization.

TI A MEASUREMENT OF THE QCD COLOR FACTOR RATIOS C-A/C-F AND T-F/C-F FROM
   ANGULAR-CORRELATIONS IN 4-JET EVENTS
SO ZEITSCHRIFT FUR PHYSIK C-PARTICLES AND FIELDS
LA English
DT Article
ID TRIPLE-GLUON VERTEX; E+E-ANNIHILATION; 4-JET EVENTS; OPAL EXPERIMENT;
   3-GLUON VERTEX; LEP; DETECTOR; DECAYS; QUARK
AB From 1 105 045 hadronic Z(0) decays observed with the OPAL detector at the LEP e(+)e(-) collider, 21 732 four-jet events are selected. A simultaneous fit of three selected angular variables from these events by the second order QCD matrix element calculation yields C-A/C-F = 2.11 +/- 0.16(stat.) +/- 0.28(syst.) T-F/C-F = 0.40 +/- 0.11(stat.) +/- 0.14(syst.) for the ratios of colour factors, in agreement with SU(3) expectations of C-A/C-F = 9/4 and T-F/C-F = 3/8.

AU KAWABE, H
   KOBAYASHI, T
   OHTSUBO, N
AF KAWABE, H
   KOBAYASHI, T
   OHTSUBO, N
TI MINIMAL STRING UNIFICATION AND CONSTRAINT ON HIDDEN SECTOR
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS B
LA English
DT Article
ID ZN ORBIFOLD MODELS; GAUGE COUPLING UNIFICATION; EFFECTIVE
   FIELD-THEORIES; SUPERSYMMETRY BREAKING; SUPERSTRING MODELS; YUKAWA
   COUPLINGS; WILSON LINES; ANOMALY CANCELLATION; MODULAR INVARIANCE; LOOP
   CORRECTIONS
AB We examine whether a minimal string model possessing the same massless spectra as the MSSM can be obtained from Z(4), Z(6) and Z(8) orbifold constructions. Using an anomaly cancellation condition of the target space duality symmetry, we derive allowable values of a level k(1) of U(1)(Y) for the minimal string model on the orbifolds through computer analyses. We investigate threshold corrections of the gauge coupling constants of SU(3), SU(2) and U(1)Y and examine consistencies of the model with the LEP experiments. It is found that Z(4) and Z(8)-II cannot derive the minimal string model but Z(6)-I, Z(6)-II and Z(8)-I are possible to derive it with k(1) = 29/21, 1 less than or equal to k(1) less than or equal to 32/21 and 1 less than or equal to k(1) less than or equal to 41/21, respectively, We obtain explicitly allowed combinations of modular weights. The minimum values of the moduli on unrotated planes are estimated within the ranges of the levels. Further we investigate what kinds of hidden sectors are consistent with the minimal string models. Also their gauge coupling constants of the hidden groups are estimated, We discuss Yukawa couplings of the models.
C1 KANAZAWA UNIV,DEPT PHYS,KANAZAWA,ISHIKAWA 92011,JAPAN.
   KANAZAWA INST TECHNOL,ISHIKAWA 921,JAPAN.
RP KAWABE, H (reprint author), YONAGO NATL COLL TECHNOL,YONAGO,TOTTORI 683,JAPAN.
CR AMALDI U, 1991, PHYS LETT B, V260, P447, DOI 10.1016/0370-2693(91)91641-8
   ANTONIADIS I, 1991, PHYS LETT B, V267, P37, DOI 10.1016/0370-2693(91)90521-Q
   ANTONIADIS I, 1991, PHYS LETT B, V272, P31, DOI 10.1016/0370-2693(91)91007-I
   BAILIN D, SUSXTH9317 PREPR

TI SPECTROSCOPY OF BE-12 AND BE-13 USING A BE-12 RADIOACTIVE BEAM
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
AB We have studied Be-12 + p elastic and inelastic scattering and observed new levels of Be-12 at E(12Be)* = 8.6, 10 and similar to 14 MeV in the vicinity of He-emission thresholds, which can be candidates for states having an exotic cluster structure with He-like subsystems. Some new states were tentatively assigned to Be-13 in studies of the d(Be-12, p) reaction.

TI CP IN ORBIFOLD MODELS
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID YUKAWA COUPLINGS; SUPERSTRING MODELS; MODULAR INVARIANCE; DISCRETE
   TORSION; GAUGE-SYMMETRY; WILSON LINES; STRINGS; VIOLATION
AB We study CP in orbifold models. It is found that the orbifolds always have some automorphisms as CP symmetry. The symmetries are restricted non-trivially due to geometrical structure of the orbifolds. Explicit analysis on Yukawa couplings also shows that CP is not violated in orbifold models.

TI HYSTERESIS OF TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENCE AND SCALING LAW IN TIME-DEPENDENCE
   OF SOUND-VELOCITY IN SINTERED BI2SR2CACU2O8+DELTA
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID CA-CU-O; HIGH-T(C) SUPERCONDUCTORS; PHASE-TRANSITION; TC; INSTABILITY;
   ALLOYS
AB The temperature T dependence of the mechanical resonance frequency f(r), of longitudinal sound waves in sintered bulk samples of Bi2Sr2CaCu2O8+delta has been measured from room temperature down to liquid-nitrogen temperature. The f(r) increases steeply around 200 K with decreasing T and on the other hand it decreases steeply around 230 K with increasing T. This hysteresis of f(r) has a width depending on the change rate of T. Keeping T at a point T-f between 230 K and 200 K, the time dependence of f(r) has been measured. The f(r) increases toward a saturated value f(rmax) on the hysteresis loop determined by T-f. When the time t is scaled by a characteristic time t(1/2) when f(r) reaches the middle point between the initial and the saturated ones, the plots of f(r)/f(rmax) versus t/t(1/2) at each T-f are almost reduced to one universal curve independent of T-f. These results suggest that the sample experiences a first-order phase transformation around those temperatures.
RP FUKAMI, T (reprint author), KYUSHU UNIV,DEPT PHYS,FUKUOKA 812,JAPAN.
CR Avrami M, 1941, J CHEM PHYS, V9, P177, DOI 10.1063/1.1750872

TI FORMATION OF METHANOL BY THE GAS-PHASE PARTIAL OXIDATION OF METHANE
   UNDER NORMAL PRESSURES
SO JOURNAL OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY-CHEMICAL COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
AB Even under normal pressures (1.5-3.0 atm), methanol is formed by the gas phase reaction of methane with oxygen in a flow quartz reactor at 425-490 degrees C with methanol selectivities exceeding 30% at a methane conversion of 5%.

TI EFFECT OF STRETCH AND RELEASE ON EQUATORIAL X-RAY-DIFFRACTION DURING A
   TWITCH CONTRACTION OF FROG SKELETAL-MUSCLE
SO BIOPHYSICAL JOURNAL
LA English
DT Article
ID RAPID MECHANICAL TRANSIENTS; TIME-RESOLVED CHANGES; SYNCHROTRON
   RADIATION; CALCIUM TRANSIENTS; TETANIC TENSION; LENGTH CHANGES; ACTIVE
   STATE; FIBERS; FORCE; STIFFNESS
AB Time-resolved intensity measurements of the x-ray equatorial reflections were made during twitch contractions of frog skeletal muscles, to which stretches or releases were applied at various times. A ramp stretch applied at the onset of a twitch (duration, 15 ms; amplitude, similar to 3% of muscle length) caused a faster and larger development of contractile force than in an isometric twitch, The stretch accelerated the decrease of the 1,0 reflection intensity (I-1,I-0). The magnitude of increase of the 1,1 reflection intensity (I-1,I-1) was reduced by the stretch, but its time course was also accelerated. A release applied at the peak of a twitch or later (duration, 5 ms; amplitude, similar to 1.5%) caused only a partial redevelopment of tension. The release produced clear reciprocal changes of reflections toward their relaxed levels, i.e., the I-1,I-0 increased and the I-1,I-1 decreased. A release applied earlier than the twitch peak had smaller effects on the reflection intensities. The results suggest that a stretch applied at the onset of a twitch causes a faster radial movement of the myosin heads toward actin, whereas a release applied at or later than the peak of a twitch accelerates their return to the thick filament backbone. The results are discussed in the context of the regulation of the myosin head attachment by calcium.
C1 NATL LAB HIGH ENERGY PHYS,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI CHARACTERIZATION OF 36-DEGREES-YX-LITAO3 WAFERS BY LINE-FOCUS-BEAM
   ACOUSTIC MICROSCOPY
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON ULTRASONICS FERROELECTRICS AND FREQUENCY CONTROL
LA English
DT Article
ID MGO-DOPED LINBO3; ELASTIC PROPERTIES; CRYSTALS
AB Application of line-focus-beam (LFB) acoustic microscopy is extended to characterization of substrates for SH-type SAW devices, Theoretical and experimental studies on a wave mode for characterization are carried out on 36 degrees Y-cut LiTaO3 wafers, A Rayleigh-type mode of leaky surface acoustic waves (LSAWs) must be employed instead of an SH-type mode of leaky pseudo-surface waves (LPSAWs), Experimental results show that the LSAW propagation should be directed along and the X-axis because the LSAW velocities are more sensitive to chemical composition and elastic inhomogeneities. The relations among the LSAW velocities, densities, and Curie temperatures are determined, The LSAW velocity increases linearly at the rate of 0.52 m/s/degrees C with the Curie temperature. A chemical composition change of 0.03 Li2O-mol%, corresponding to temperature resolution of better than 0.3 degrees C, is easily detected by the velocity measurements. Elastic inhomogeneities due to residual multi-domains, produced during the poling process during wafer fabrication, are interpreted quantitatively by this ultrasonic technology.

TI INTERPRETATION OF PERPENDICULAR MAGNETIC-ANISOTROPY IN TRANSITION-METAL
   NOBLE-METAL SUPERLATTICE FILMS IN TERMS OF PAIR MODEL
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE PERPENDICULAR MAGNETIC ANISOTROPY; TRANSITION METAL; NOBLE METAL;
   SUPERLATTICE FILM; PSEUDODIPOLAR INTERACTION; PAIR MODEL
ID EPITAXIAL CO/PD SUPERLATTICES; LAYERED STRUCTURES; MULTILAYERS; PD/CO
AB In the present work, we have attempted to interpret the perpendicular magnetic anisotropy in the transition metal/noble metal superlattice films, which has been calculated for different growth directions and crystal structures, in terms of the pair model. The surface anisotropy has been found to result from the pseudodipolar interaction energy at the interface or in a few layers near the interface, while it is cancelled out in the interior of the transition metal film. The volume magnetic anisotropy, another main origin in addition to the demagnetizing energy, has been interpreted in terms of the pseudodipolar interaction, taking into account strains which are due to mis fit in lattice constants between the transition metal and noble metal films.
RP MASUDA, M (reprint author), MIE UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT ELECT & ELECTR ENGN,TSU,MIE 514,JAPAN.

TI INTERFACIAL DEGRADATION OF INSULATOR YBA2CU3OY HETEROSTRUCTURE DUE TO
   MUTUAL DIFFUSION OF CONSTITUENT ATOMS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE OXIDE SUPERCONDUCTOR; THIN FILM; HETEROSTRUCTURE; EXCIMER LASER
   ABLATION; MISFET; DIELECTRIC
AB The interfacial degradation of the insulator (SrTiO3, BaTiO3, PbTiO3, and BaO etc.)/YBa2Cu3Oy heterostructures during excimer-laser deposition and subsequent annealing has been investigated.  The secondary-ion mass spectroscopy (SIMS) measurement revealed, though very crudely, the mutual diffusion of constituent atoms.  More precise data have been obtained quantitatively by measuring the change of the zero-resistance temperatures T(c0)'s (Kosterlitz-Thoules transition) of ultrathin YBa2CuOy before and after deposition of the insulating layers and annealing.  The interfacial degradation developed with time t as t approximately 0.4, reflecting the thermal diffusion of constituents.  The degradation also depended on the partnering insulating layer, i.e., it was minimized by BaTiO3 and PbTiO3 (lower-melting-point insulators).
RP ASHIDA, T (reprint author), OSAKA UNIV,FAC ENGN SCI,1-3 MACHIKANEYAMA,TOYONAKA,OSAKA 560,JAPAN.

AU KOBAYASHI, T
   KURISHIMA, K
   GOSELE, U
AF KOBAYASHI, T
   KURISHIMA, K
   GOSELE, U
TI GROWTH TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENCE OF ZN DIFFUSION IN INP/INGAAS
   HETEROJUNCTION BIPOLAR-TRANSISTOR STRUCTURES GROWN BY METALORGANIC
   CHEMICAL-VAPOR-DEPOSITION
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 8th International Conference on Vapour Growth and Epitaxy
CY JUL 24-29, 1994
CL FREIBURG, GERMANY
SP GERMAN ASSOC CRYSTAL GROWTH, INT ORG CRYSTAL GROWTH
HO ALBERT LUDWIGS UNIV, KRISTALLOGRAPH INST
ID GALLIUM-ARSENIDE; ZINC; GAAS; REDISTRIBUTION; PROFILES
AB We investigate the behavior of zinc impurities in InP/InGaAs heterojunction bipolar transistor (HBT) structures grown by a low pressure metalorganic chemical vapor deposition (MOCVD) technique. When using this technique, zinc is anomalously diffused in InP/InGaAs HBTs with a heavily Si-doped subcollector layer (2 X 10(19) cm(-3)) when the growth temperature before the base-layer growth is higher or lower than around 600 degrees C. On the other hand, an abrupt zinc profile in the same HBT structure is realized when the growth temperature of the subcollector layer is 600 degrees C. Two kinds of point defect reactions which depend strongly on the growth temperature are proposed. In one, excess group III interstitials which are produced in a heavily Si-doped subcollector layer are easily removed and, in the other, the equilibrium concentration of charged group-III Vacancies decreases as the growth temperature increases. According to this model, complete suppression of an undesired Zn diffusion can be realized by using a growth interruption technique for obtaining the point defect equilibrium before a base-layer growth at 550 degrees C when the growth temperature of the subcollector layer is either lower or higher than 600 degrees C. Thus, either interrupting the growth for an appropriate period of time before the base layer growth or using an appropriate growth temperature for the subcollector is essential for obtaining an abrupt Zn profile in an HBT structure with a heavily doped subcollector layer.
C1 MAX PLANCK INST MIKROSTRUKT PHYS,D-06120 HALLE,GERMANY.
RP KOBAYASHI, T (reprint author), NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,LSI LABS,3-1 MORINOSATO WAKAMIYA,ATSUGI,KANAGAWA 24301,JAPAN.
CR ASBECK PM, 1987, IEEE T ELECTRON DEV, V34, P2571, DOI 10.1109/T-ED.1987.23356
   DEPPE DG, 1990, APPL PHYS LETT, V56, P370, DOI 10.1063/1.102788
   ENQUIST P, 1988, J APPL PHYS, V63, P4485, DOI 10.1063/1.340143
   ENQUIST PM, 1988, J CRYST GROWTH, V93, P637, DOI 10.1016/0022-0248(88)90596-9

TI PRECISE DETERMINATION OF THE EPITAXIAL ORIENTATION OF A MONOMOLECULAR
   LAYER ORGANIC FILM BY SCANNING-TUNNELING-MICROSCOPY
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 8th International Conference on Vapour Growth and Epitaxy
CY JUL 24-29, 1994
CL FREIBURG, GERMANY
SP GERMAN ASSOC CRYSTAL GROWTH, INT ORG CRYSTAL GROWTH
HO ALBERT LUDWIGS UNIV, KRISTALLOGRAPH INST
ID THIN-FILMS; 1,4-DITHIOKETO-3,6-DIPHENYL-PYRROLO-<3,4-C>-PYRROLE;
   GRAPHITE; IMAGES
AB Epitaxial films of 1,4-dithioketo-3,6-diphenyl-pyrrolo-[3,4c]-pyrrole (DTPP) on graphite (0001) were investigated by scanning tunneling microscopy (STM). In the STM images, one-dimensional periodic modulation of image contrast was observed in addition to each molecular image, which was interpreted as moire fringe caused by the interaction with a graphite lattice. Following to mathematical analysis, such one-dimensional periodic modulation was concluded to appear only under the condition that every lattice point of the deposited film is on an (m, n)-line of the substrate lattice for certain integers m and n. Using this property, the epitaxial orientation of DTPP with respect to the substrate lattice was determined precisely. The resulting orientation exhibits no exact commensurate relation with graphite, but every lattice point of DTPP was found to lie on a lattice-line parallel to the b-axis ((1, 0)-line) of graphite.
RP HOSHINO, A (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV,INST CHEM RES,UJI,KYOTO 611,JAPAN.
CR ARITA M, 1991, J APPL PHYS, V70, P4065, DOI 10.1063/1.349156

TI PSEUDOMORPHIC VANADYL-PHTHALOCYANINE AND ITS STABLE ORIENTATION ON KBR
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 8th International Conference on Vapour Growth and Epitaxy
CY JUL 24-29, 1994
CL FREIBURG, GERMANY
SP GERMAN ASSOC CRYSTAL GROWTH, INT ORG CRYSTAL GROWTH
HO ALBERT LUDWIGS UNIV, KRISTALLOGRAPH INST
ID EPITAXIAL-GROWTH; FILMS
AB Vanadyl-phthalocyanine (VOPc) was found recently to form a pseudomorphic structure on the KBr (001) surface. In order to simulate the initial growth stage, the adsorption energy of molecules of vapor-deposited VOPc was calculated including Van der Waals, electrostatic and induced dipole interactions, in which the charge distribution in a molecule estimated from an ab-initio molecular orbital (MO) calculation was used. The calculation was carried out for the initial growth stage; an adsorbed VOPc molecule on KBr and also a monolayer of VOPc molecules on KBr. The energetically preferred adsorption occurs when the V atom is set directly on the K+ ion and the isoindole ring of VOPc orients almost along [100] of KBr. Such orientation of the molecule agrees well with that determined by structure analysis based on electron crystallography, but not with the adsorption posture proposed so far.
RP HASHIMOTO, S (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV,INST CHEM RES,UJI,KYOTO 611,JAPAN.

TI CHROMATOGRAPHIC-SEPARATION OF STRONTIUM AND CESIUM WITH MIXED ZEOLITE
   COLUMN
SO JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
DE CHROMATOGRAPHIC SEPARATION; HEAT-GENERATING NUCLIDES; STRONTIUM 90;
   STRONTIUM IONS; CESIUM 137; CESIUM IONS; HIGH-LEVEL RADIOACTIVE WASTES;
   INORGANIC ION-EXCHANGERS; DISTRIBUTION COEFFICIENT; MONOVALENT CATIONS;
   RETENTION VOLUME
ID REMOVAL
AB Chromatographic separation of heat-generating nuclides Sr-90 and Cs-137 from high-level liquid wastes has been studied by means of column packed with inorganic ion-exchangers. The distribution coefficients (K-d) Of Sr2+ and Cs+ onto zeolites decreased with increasing concentrations of monovalent cations. The retention volumes (V-R) with a 2 M (=mol/dm(3)) NH4Cl solution decreased in the order, natural mordenite (NM) much greater than chabazite>clinoptilolite for Cs+, and titanic acid much greater than zeolite Y for Sr-2+, The column containing mixtures of Y and NM was effective for selective adsorption of Sr2+ and Cs+ from a simulated waste solution, and chromatographic separation of these adsorbed nuclides was accomplished by passing a 2 M NH4Cl solution through the column of mixing ratio of Y:NM=3:2.
RP MIMURA, H (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,INST ADV MAT PROC,AOBA KU,SENDAI,MIYAGI 98077,JAPAN.

TI INVESTIGATION OF CELL RESISTANCE FOR MOLTEN-SALT ELECTROREFINING OF
   SPENT NUCLEAR-FUEL
SO JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
DE MOLTEN SALTS; ELECTROREFINING; SPENT FUELS; CELL RESISTANCE; FINITE
   ELEMENT METHOD; LIQUID CADMIUM ANODE; SOLID CATHODE; LIQUID CADMIUM
   CATHODE; INTEGRAL FAST REACTOR; POLARIZATION; EXPERIMENTAL DATA
AB Cell resistance for molten salt electrorefining of spent nuclear fuel under various electrode configurations was investigated by using the two-dimensional finite element method. Three electrorefining cell configurations were evaluated; (1) a liquid Cd anode and a solid cathode made of low carbon steel with or without a ceramic plate at the bottom, (2) a liquid Cd anode and a liquid Cd cathode, and (3) two anodes in the form of a perforated steel basket filled with spent nuclear fuel and two solid cathodes, in two different arrangements. The calculated results agreed reasonably well with previously obtained experimental data. The effect of polarization on the cell resistance was found to be small for a typical uranium concentration in the molten salt electrolyte and the liquid Cd anode. The calculation results are helpful in interpreting experimental data, and a correlation formula was developed that may be useful in estimating the cell resistance of new cell designs.
C1 CENT RES INST ELECT POWER IND,KOMAE LAB,KOMAE,TOKYO 201,JAPAN.

TI DEVELOPMENT OF LOW-POWER LSI CHIP SETS FOR SDH TRANSMISSION EQUIPMENT
SO NEC RESEARCH & DEVELOPMENT
LA English
DT Article
DE SDH (SYNCHRONOUS DIGITAL HIERARCHY) TERMINATION; TIME SWITCH; LINE
   DRIVER RECEIVER; SMALL-SIZE; LOW-POWER; RAM; LSI
AB Various equipments have been developed based on Synchronous Digital Hierarchy (SDH) for digital network services. For the recent popularization of SDH, it is necessary that these equipments should have a complex function with small-size and low-power consumption. The authors have developed the 156 Mbps/52 Mbps termination LSIs, the time switch LSI for digital cross-connect, and the 156 MHz interface LSI with the half micron CMOS device, and succeeded in developing low-power consumption equipments by using these devices. For the purpose of low-power consumption and high-speed processing of these devices, they have developed new circuit technologies such as 156 MHz line driver/receiver, 156 MHz multiplexer/demultiplexer, small-size register files and very low-power 2-port RAM, and new design technologies of LSI layout.

TI SINGLE BUNCHED BEAM GENERATION WITHOUT SUBHARMONIC PREBUNCHER
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS
   SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
LA English
DT Article
ID LASER-IRRADIATED PHOTOCATHODE; ELECTRON
AB The intensity of the accelerated single bunched electron beam depends on the performance of the electron gun and the fast cathode pulser. The electron beam is emitted by a Y-796 cathode assembly with a cathode of 2 cm(2) (8 A/cm(2)), and an extracted voltage of 90 kV. The maximum charge of the single bunched beam was attained at 1.5 nC/pulse using SHB. Recently, a single bunched beam has been generated by an ultrafast cathode pulser (rise and fall time < 100 ps pulse height -2 kV at 50 Omega) without SHB. The charge of the accelerated electron beam is about 40 pC/pulse (pulse width < 10 ps) without the production of a satellite beam. This result show that a single bunched beam can be produced by the linear accelerator without SHB.
C1 NATL LAB HIGH ENERGY PHYS,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
   OSAKA UNIV,INST SCI & IND RES,IBARAKI,OSAKA 567,JAPAN.

AU KOBAYASHI, T
AF KOBAYASHI, T
TI ANALYSIS OF CLASSICAL-SOLUTIONS IN SCHROEDINGER EQUATIONS BASED ON THE
   IDEA OF NONSTANDARD ANALYSIS AND HARMONIC-OSCILLATOR MOTIONS
SO NUOVO CIMENTO DELLA SOCIETA ITALIANA DI FISICA B-GENERAL PHYSICS
   RELATIVITY ASTRONOMY AND MATHEMATICAL PHYSICS AND METHODS
LA English
DT Article
ID QUANTUM
AB Classical limits of quantum mechanics are studied on the basis of non-standard analysis.  Following the idea of ultra eigenpairs in quantum mechanics extended to non-standard numbers, the exact equality in the Schroedinger equation is replaced by the approximate equality by taking h as an infinitestimal (h almost-equal-to 0) and the classical limit is introduced as the operation represented by taking the standard part with respect to h defined in the non-standard analysis.  We find out that the ultra eigenfucntions which results from the extention of the exact equality to the approximate equality in the equation represent classical stationary states in the classical limit.  As an explicit example we study harmonic-oscillator motions and derive two types of solutions:  one is given by the solutions for stationary states described by ultra eigenfunctions on the extended Hilbert space *H and the other by the solutions for non-stationary states represented by coherent states which are expressed as the superposition of eigenfunctions given by the non-standard extension of Hermite polynomials.  We see that the former represents the statistical nature of quantum wave functions, while the latter their particle nature.  Both solutions are shown to reproduce classical motions exactly in the classical limit.  All interferences among different classical solutions disappear in the limit.  We also see that the ultra eigenfunctions representing the stationary states cover not only the extensions of the eigenfunctions for the original potential, but also those for potentals which differ from the original one by an order smaller than h.  That is, they are spanned over many Hilbert spaces which differ one another in quantum-mechanical worlds where h = a non-infinitesimal number is required.  In the argument for measurements on the stationary states we see that the crucial difference between quantum mechanics and classical mechanics in expressed as follows; quantum mechanics does not have any infinitesimal physical constants in the theory, while classical mechanics does, i.e. h almost-equal-to 0 in this approach.  Relations between detectors in physics and filters in non-standard analysis is also pointed out.  The Schroedinger equation with the approximate equality based on the idea of the non-standard analysis is proposed as the fundamental equation for the unified theory describing quantum and classical phenomena simultaneously.
RP KOBAYASHI, T (reprint author), UNIV TSUKUBA,INST PHYS,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
CR Albeverio S., 1986, NONSTANDARD METHODS, P562
   FARRUKH MO, 1975, J MATH PHYS, V16, P177, DOI 10.1063/1.522525
   KOBAYASHI T, 1993, 7 P S SYMM SCI, P287
   KOBAYASHI T, 1993, IN PRESS 3 P INT WIG
   KOBAYASHI T, IN PRESS F PHYS LETT
   MACHIDA S, 1980, PROG THEOR PHYS, V63, P1457, DOI 10.1143/PTP.63.1457
   NAMIKI M, 1988, FOUND PHYS, V18, P29, DOI 10.1007/BF01882872
   NAMIKI M, 1993, PHYS REP, V232, P301, DOI 10.1016/0370-1573(93)90085-R
   ROBINSON A, 1970, NON STANDARD ANAL
   Schrodinger E, 1926, NATURWISSENSCHAFTEN, V14, P664

TI EFFECTS OF SPATIAL COHERENCE AND DISPERSIVE DIFFRACTION ON A CHANGE IN
   OPTICAL-SPECTRUM
SO OPTICAL REVIEW
LA English
DT Article
DE SPECTRAL CHANGE; POLYCHROMATIC SPATIALLY PARTIALLY COHERENT SOURCE;
   SPATIAL COHERENCE CONTROL; SUPER-LUMINESCENT DIODE AS A SPECTRAL SOURCE;
   RED AND BLUE SHIFT OF THE SPECTRUM; THEORY AND EXPERIMENTS
ID SPACE-FREQUENCY DOMAIN; LIGHT; REDSHIFTS; BLUESHIFTS; APERTURE; LINES
AB This paper describes a change in optical spectrum on propagation in free space for a particular class of spatially partially coherent fields emanating from a polychromatic secondary source. A rectangular opening aperture in an opaque screen, illuminated with an extended incoherent polychromatic primary source, works as the secondary source. The spectral change is explored in detail theoretically and experimentally in association with spatial coherence in the secondary source as well as dispersive diffraction by the secondary source. The peak shift of the spectrum is associated with the coherence area for characterizing the secondary source. The peak shift becomes maximum if the secondary source is spatially coherent, but no shift occurs if the secondary source is spatially incoherent.
RP OHTSUKA, Y (reprint author), HOKKAIDO UNIV, FAC ENGN, DEPT ENGN SCI, SAPPORO, HOKKAIDO 060, JAPAN.

PT J
AU ULLRICH, B
   KOBAYASHI, T
AF ULLRICH, B
   KOBAYASHI, T
TI A NEW ARCHITECTURE FOR OPTICAL-DATA PROCESSING DEVICES BY THE
   APPLICATION OF BISTABILITY IN LUMINESCENCE
SO OPTICAL REVIEW
LA English
DT Article
DE ALL-OPTICAL LUMINESCENCE BISTABILITY; ALL-OPTICAL DATA PROCESSING
   DEVICES; HYBRID DATA PROCESSING DEVICES; THIN FILMS; II-VI COMPOUNDS
ID THIN CDS FILMS
AB Recently, we have discovered that-besides the all-optical photo-thermal bistability in transmission-the excitation of thin CdS films with the 514.5 nm line of an argon laser causes all-optical bistability in the luminescent radiation. The emitted radiation of the CdS layers lies far enough in the infrared region of the spectrum so that all-optical bistability in luminescence can be observed through GaAs wafers, i.e. an all-optical bistable loop remains in the direction of the propagation of the incident laser beam even though GaAs is strongly absorptive at the excitation wavelength. On the basis of this penetrating feature of all-optical bistability, we present a new concept for an architecture of future optical data processing devices.
RP ULLRICH, B (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO, DEPT PHYS, BUNKYO KU, 7-3-1 HONGO, TOKYO 113, JAPAN.

TI SENSITIZATION OF POLYMERIC TRACK DETECTORS WITH CARBON-DIOXIDE
SO RADIATION MEASUREMENTS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 17th International Conference on Nuclear Tracks in Solids
CY AUG 24-28, 1994
CL DUBNA, RUSSIA
SP Joint Inst Nucl Res
DE SR-90; CR-39; POLYMER; TRACK DETECTOR; HIGH SENSITIVITY; AGING; CARBON
   DIOXIDE
ID CR-39
AB The effect of CO2 on the sensitivity of polymeric track detectors was studied, It has been found that the sensitivity of SR-90 is dependent on the amount of CO2 dissolved in the polymer at the time of etching. It has been also found that CR-39 can be sensitized to some extent with an aging in CO2. Since the sensitization in CO2 is possible even a long time after the irradiation, the mechanism of the latent track formation by CO2 is quite different from that by O-2. This would be the key to achieve the long term stability of polymeric track detectors such as SR-90 and CR-39.
C1 INST SPACE & ASTRONAUT SCI,SAGAMIHARA,KANAGAWA 229,JAPAN.
   AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,SETAGAYA KU,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.
   FUKUVI CHEM IND CO LTD,FUKUI 91905,JAPAN.

CR Benton E.V., 1972, 19 U SAN FRANC INT T, P1

AU NISHIMURA, T
   KOBAYASHI, T
   TANAKA, S
   SUGIMURA, T
AF NISHIMURA, T
   KOBAYASHI, T
   TANAKA, S
   SUGIMURA, T
BE Arnault, S
TI MONITORING OF OCEANIC TURBULENCE AROUND JAPAN ISLANDS
SO SATELLITE MONITORING OF THE EARTH'S SURFACE AND ATMOSPHERE
SE ADVANCES IN SPACE RESEARCH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT A1 Symposium of COSPAR Scientific Commission A on Satellite Monitoring
   of the Earths Surface and Atmosphere, at the 13th COSPAR Scientific
   Assembly
CY JUL 11-21, 1994
CL HAMBURG, GERMANY
SP Comm Space Res
AB Based on kinematic features of the coherent structure, dominant in the oceanic turbulence around Japan Islands, obtained from the NOAA/AVHRR monitoring, the Kuroshio behavior was discussed. Most eddies shed from cusped capes on the Pacific-Coast increase the turbulent boundary layer, and form an organized coherent structure of mesoscale eddies interlocked in the Shikoku-Basin. Some eddies shed from the Cape-Shionomisaki, however, trap part of the Kuroshio watermass and deviate it coastward, leading to a decay of the boundary layer. The formed coherent structure induces the basin-scale Kuroshio variability, which has usually been described through the meandering and nonmeandering phenomena of the Kuroshio path.
C1 REMOTE SENSING TECHNOL CTR JAPAN,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
RP NISHIMURA, T (reprint author), SCI UNIV TOKYO,2641 YAMAZAKI,NODA,CHIBA 278,JAPAN.

TI MEASUREMENT OF THE TAU LEPTON POLARIZATION AND ITS FORWARD-BACKWARD
   ASYMMETRY FROM Z(0) DECAYS
SO ZEITSCHRIFT FUR PHYSIK C-PARTICLES AND FIELDS
LA English
DT Article
ID MONTE-CARLO; RADIATIVE-CORRECTIONS; PHOTON CORRECTIONS; BHABHA
   SCATTERING; OPAL EXPERIMENT; HIGH-ENERGIES; Z-RESONANCE; DETECTOR;
   PROGRAM; QUARK
AB We report on a measurement of the tau lepton polarization and its forward-backward asymmetry at the Z(0) resonance using the OPAL detector. This measurement is based on analyses of the tau-->e<(nu)over bar>(e) nu(tau), tau-->mu<(nu)over bar>(mu)nu(tau), tau-->pi(K)nu(tau) and tau-->rho nu(tau)decays from a sample of 30663 e(+)e(-)-->tau(+)tau(-) events collected during the years 1990 to 1992. Assuming that the tau lepton decays according to V-A theory, we measure the average tau polarization to be [P-tau] = (-14.9 +/- 1.9 +/- 1.3)% and the tau polarization forward-backward asymmetry to be A(pol)(FB) = (-8.9 +/- 2.2 +/- 0.9)%, where the first error is statistical and the second systematic. These results are consistent with the hypothesis of lepton universality. When combined under the assumption of universality, our results can be interpreted as a measurement of sin(2) theta(eff)(lept) = 0.2321 +/- 0.0023 within the context of the Standard Model.
C1 UCL, LONDON WC1E 6BT, ENGLAND.

TI MEASUREMENT OF GAMMA(Z(0)-]B(B)OVER-BAR)/GAMMA(Z(0)-]HADRONS) USING A
   DOUBLE TAGGING METHOD
SO ZEITSCHRIFT FUR PHYSIK C-PARTICLES AND FIELDS
LA English
DT Article
ID HADRONIC Z0 DECAYS; SEMILEPTONIC BRANCHING RATIOS; PROMPT ELECTRON
   PRODUCTION; FERMION PAIR PRODUCTION; HEAVY FLAVOR PRODUCTION; OPAL JET
   CHAMBER; LUND MONTE-CARLO; E+E ANNIHILATION; Z(0) DECAYS; INCLUSIVE
   PRODUCTION
AB The fraction of Z(0) --> b (b) over bar events in hadronic Z(0) decays has been measured using the data collected by OPAL in 1992 and 1993. The presence of electrons or muons from semileptonic decays of bottom hadrons and the detection of bottom hadron decay vertices were used together to obtain an event sample enriched in Z(0) --> b (b) over bar decays. To reduce the systematic error on the measurement of the Z(0) --> b (b) over bar fraction, the efficiency of the b (b) over bar event tagging was obtained from the data by comparing the numbers of events having a bottom signature in either one or both thrust hemispheres. A value of Gamma(Z(0) --> b (b) over bar)/Gamma(Z(0) --> hadrons) = 0.2171 +/- 0.0021 +/- 0.0021 was obtained, where the first error is statistical and the second systematic. The uncertainty on the decay width Gamma(Z(0) --> c (c) over bar) is not included in these errors. A fractional variation of this width by +/-8% about its Standard Model prediction would result in a variation of the measured Z(0) --> b (b) over bar fraction of double dagger 0.0015.

TI DETERMINATION OF EVENT SHAPE DISTRIBUTION AND ALPHA(B)(S) FROM
   Z(0)-]B(B)OVER-BAR EVENTS AT LEP
SO ZEITSCHRIFT FUR PHYSIK C-PARTICLES AND FIELDS
LA English
DT Article
ID ELECTRON-POSITRON ANNIHILATION; LUND MONTE-CARLO; QUANTUM
   CHROMODYNAMICS; E+E ANNIHILATION; ENERGY CORRELATIONS; JET
   FRAGMENTATION; OPAL EXPERIMENT; Z(0) RESONANCE; ORDER QCD; DETECTOR
AB In hadronic Z(0) decays collected by the OPAL experiment at LEP, event shape variables such as jet rates, jet masses, thrust and the energy-energy correlation for Z(0) --> b (b) over bar events are compared to those for all flavours using secondary vertex information to tag the b quarks. The measured distributions are found to be well described by an O(alpha(s)) calculation for heavy quarks as well as by parton shower simulations. We also determine the ratio of the strong coupling constant for b quacks and all quarks, alpha(s)(b)/alpha(s)(incl), from these distributions. We find alpha(s)(b)/alpha(s)(incl) = 0.994 +/- 0.005 (+0.010)(-0.012), where the errors are the statistical and systematic errors. The result can be converted into the ratio for b quarks relative to the complementary flavours udsc alpha(s)(b)/alpha(s)(udsc) = 0.992 +/- 0.007 (+0.013)(-0.015).
C1 UNIV BIRMINGHAM, SCH PHYS & SPACE RES, BIRMINGHAM B15 2TT, W MIDLANDS, ENGLAND.

TI MEASUREMENT OF SINGLE-PHOTON PRODUCTION IN E(+)E- COLLISIONS NEAR THE
   Z(0) RESONANCE
SO ZEITSCHRIFT FUR PHYSIK C-PARTICLES AND FIELDS
LA English
DT Article
ID INVISIBLE WIDTH; E+E COLLISIONS; OPAL EXPERIMENT; HIGGS-BOSON; Z0 DECAY;
   LEP; NEUTRINO; DETECTOR; SEARCH; ANNIHILATION
AB A measurement of the single photon production cross-section is presented based on a data-sample of 40.5 pb(-1) collected with the OPAL detector at centre-of-mass energies within 3 GeV of the Z(0) mass. Single photon events arise from initial state radiation and the production of an ''invisible'' final state consisting of neutrinos or possibly particles such as sneutrinos or photinos. The single photon topology is also sensitive to new Z(0) decays such as Z(0) --> <(nu)over bar>nu* --> <(nu)over bar nu gamma or Z(0) --> gamma X, X --> invisible particles. A total of 447 single photon candidates were observed with energy exceeding 1.75 GeV in the polar angle region \cos theta\ < 0.7. The estimated background from processes with visible reaction products, mainly e(+)e(-) --> e(+)e(-)gamma, is 37 +/- 6 events. Interpreting the cross-sections as being solely due to Z(0) decay to invisible particles and the expected W-contributions, the Z(0) invisible width is determined to be 539 +/- 26 +/- 17 MeV corresponding to N-nu = 3.23 +/- 0.16 +/- 0.10 light neutrino generations. The differential cross-section with photon energy is presented. Upper limits are set on additional invisible contributions to the Z(0) width, on possible non-resonant processes, and on Z(0) decays to single photons. The energy spectra are used to constrain exotic sources of high energy single photons. In particular, the radiative two-body decay of the Z(0) to a new particle X, with mass below 64 GeV and an invisible signature, has a Z(0) branching ratio of less than 4.3 x 10(-6) at 95 % confidence level.

TI DETERMINATION OF AN UPPER LIMIT FOR THE MASS OF THE TAU-NEUTRINO AT LEP
SO ZEITSCHRIFT FUR PHYSIK C-PARTICLES AND FIELDS
LA English
DT Article
ID OPAL JET CHAMBER; DETECTOR; PROGRAM; DECAYS
AB An upper limit for the nu(tau) mass is determined through the kinematic reconstruction of the decay tau --> 5 pi(+/-)nu(tau) in the OPAL detector at LEP. The limit is obtained using a new method based on the comparison of the two-dimensional distribution of energy and invariant mass of the five-pion system with expectations from different neutrino mass hypotheses. From a sample of five events surviving the selection criteria we obtain an upper limit of 74 MeV at 95% confidence level. It is the first measurement at LEP energies, where the larger average multiplicity of e(+)e(-) --> q (q) over bar events makes the suppression of this background more robust compared to lower energies.
C1 UNIV BIRMINGHAM,SCH PHYS & SPACE RES,BIRMINGHAM B15 2TT,W MIDLANDS,ENGLAND.

AU ZHU, KD
   KOBAYASHI, T
AF ZHU, KD
   KOBAYASHI, T
TI INTRINSIC SELF-LOCALIZED FRENKEL EXCITONS IN A LINEAR-CHAIN OF
   INTERACTING FRENKEL EXCITONS
SO PHYSICS LETTERS A
LA English
DT Article
ID 2-PHOTON OPTICAL BISTABILITY; FABRY-PEROT CAVITY; ANTIFERROMAGNETS;
   MAGNONS; MODES
AB The intrinsic self-localized Frenkel excitons due to the strong exciton-exciton static dipolar attraction in one-dimensional molecular chains are theoretically shown to exist below the exciton frequency band. The numerical results for the eigenfrequeny and profile function of the intrinsic self-localized Frenkel exciton are obtained in the strong-localization limit.

TI CONTROL OF NONADIABATIC PHOTODISSOCIATION OF SODIUM-IODIDE USING
   ULTRASHORT PUMP AND CONTROL PULSES
SO CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID INFRARED-LASER PULSES; VIBRATIONAL-EXCITATION; MOLECULAR-DYNAMICS;
   DISSOCIATION
AB We present a practical method for controlling non-adiabatic photodissociation on the basis of wave-packet theory.  The ratio of the two reaction channels in the photodissociation of NaI can be controlled by changing the pulse width of two successive short pulses.  We can control the reaction most effectively when we use a chirped pulse with approximately optimized chirp parameters.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT CHEM,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI OPTICAL IN-SITU ANALYSIS OF GAAS/ALAS/GAAS AND GAAS/(AL)GAAS/GAAS ATOMIC
   LAYER GROWTH USING GACL(3), ALCL(3) AND ASH(3)
SO APPLIED SURFACE SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3rd International Symposium on Atomic Layer Epitaxy and Related Surface
   Processes (ALE-3)
CY MAY 25-27, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS, JAPAN SOC PROMOT SCI, COMM NANO METER STRUCT & ELECTR
ID EPITAXY; GAAS; ALAS; ASH3
AB Atomic layer growth of AlAs and AlGaAs were tried by alternate supply of GaCl3, AlCl3 and AsH3, and the growth process was monitored by an optical method such as the surface photo-absorption (SPA) method and the optical interference method.  Although atomic layer epitaxy (ALE) of GaAs can be performed by alternate supply of GaCl3 and AsH3, that of AlAs on GaAs could not be obtained, probably due to surface oxidation of AlAs.  AlAs, however, could be grown by simultaneous supply of AlCl3 and AsH3.  It was confirmed by the SPA signal that if the AlCl3-adsorbed AlAs surface is exposed to GaCl3, the adsorbed AlCl3 is replaced by GaCl and/or GaCl and GaAs ALE growth on AlAs can be performed.  A slightly Al-containing (Al)GaAs layer could be grown by addition of AlCl3 to GaCl3 in GaAs ALE growth.
C1 UNIV TSUKUBA,INST MAT SCI,1-1-1 TENNOHDAI,TSUKUBAI,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI THEORETICAL-STUDIES OF AMMONIA-HALOGEN AND METHYLAMINE-HALOGEN COMPLEXES
   - GEOMETRIES, HARMONIC VIBRATIONAL FREQUENCIES AND THEIR INFRARED
   INTENSITIES, AND EXCITED-STATES OF AMMONIA-CHLORINE MONOFLUORIDE COMPLEX
SO BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID ABSORPTION BANDS
AB The electron correlation effects for the geometry and stability of the ammonia-halogen (NH3-Cl-2 and NH3-ClF) and the methylamine-halogen (CH3NH2-Cl-2 and CH3NH2-ClF) are examined with ab initio molecular orbital calculations. The intermolecular distance, tau(N-Cl), with the second order Moller-Presset (MP2) method are substantially shorten from the corresponding values with the self-consistent field (SCF) method. The halogen-halogen distance is slightly lengthened with the MP2 method from those determined with the SCF calculations. With the MP2 method the stabilization energies (Delta E) become large from those of the SCF calculation. Large high-frequency shifts for two intra CH3-NH2 coupled motions are found. The frequency shift and intensity change in the complex formation are mode-specific. The potential energy surfaces of the ground and low-lying excited states of NH3-ClF complex are calculated with the configuration interaction method. The first excited state is directly dissociated to NH3Cl+F. The charge-transfer excited state lies higher than the pi*-->sigma* transition of ClF molecule, and is dissociated into NH3+Cl+F. The NH3Cl (C-3 nu symmetry), generated from the lowest excited states, is a stable radical. The reaction NH3Cl-->NH2+HCl is also endothermic, though the high barrier prevents the hydrogen shift to chlorine.
C1 KEIO UNIV,FAC SCI & TECHNOL,DEPT CHEM,KOHOKU KU,YOKOHAMA,KANAGAWA 223,JAPAN.

TI CHARACTERISTICS OF SUB-1/4-MU-M GATE SURFACE CHANNEL PMOSFETS USING A
   MULTILAYER GATE STRUCTURE OF BORON-DOPED POLY-SI ON THIN NITROGEN-DOPED
   POLY-SI
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON ELECTRON DEVICES
LA English
DT Article
ID P-CHANNEL; N-CHANNEL; MOSFETS
AB This paper reports the effects of a new p(+) gate structure (MEN gate) on the properties of surface channel PMOSFET's with an extremely thin gate oxide, The MBN gate is a multilayer gate structure of boron-doped poly Si on thin nitrogen-doped poly-Si, The thin nitrogen-doped Si layer effectively suppresses boron diffusion, so that the gate poly Si can be doped with boron in high concentration without the fear of boron penetration, Gate depletion effects are well suppressed, Effective hole mobility is improved due to the reduction of the initial interface state density, The hot-hole induced interface state generation is shown to be the dominant cause of degradation in the 1/4-mu m level PMOSFET's, and less Gm degradation is found in the MEN-gate PMOSFET's than in conventional p(+)-gate PMOSFET's. Finally, with respect to the reliability of the gate oxide, a conventional p(+) gate with boron penetration exhibits an increase in short-time defect related breakdown during constant-current FN stressing, Short-time defect-related breakdown is not observed in the MBN gate but a slight decrease in charge to breakdown.
RP OKAZAKI, Y (reprint author), NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,LSI LABS,3-1 MORINOSATO WAKAMIYA,ATSUGI,KANAGAWA 24301,JAPAN.

TI HIGHLY SELECTIVE INGAAS GROWTH BY METALORGANIC CHEMICAL-VAPOR-DEPOSITION
   WITH A HIGH-SPEED ROTATING SUSCEPTOR
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7th International Conference on Metalorganic Vapor Phase Epitaxy
   (ICMOVPE-VII)
CY MAY 31-JUN 03, 1994
CL YOKOHAMA, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS, FDN ADV INT SCI
ID LOW-PRESSURE MOCVD; OMVPE; INP
AB Selective InGaAs growth using a metalorganic chemical vapor deposition (MOCVD) reactor with a susceptor that can be rotated at high speed is studied at various growth temperatures and growth rates. The high-speed rotating susceptor enables the selective growth of InGaAs at very low temperatures, about 200 degrees C lower than in conventional selective MOCVD growth. The critical growth rate for selective growth can also be expanded to a much higher range with this technique. It is considered that the improved selectivity is due to the high velocity of the gas flow just above the susceptor caused by a high-speed rotation, which results in a low surface supersaturation ratio of adsorbed species on the mask. We also estimate the supersaturation ratios using a nuclei formation model with the change in Gibbs free energy. It is found that the supersaturation ratio at 1400 rpm is reduced to about one third of the ratio at 200 rpm.
RP IDA, M (reprint author), NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,LSI LABS,3-1 MORINOSATO WAKAMIYA,ATSUGI,KANAGAWA 24301,JAPAN.

TI METALORGANIC CHEMICAL-VAPOR-DEPOSITION GROWN ALGAAS LASERS WITH GROWN
   OPTICAL FACETS
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7th International Conference on Metalorganic Vapor Phase Epitaxy
   (ICMOVPE-VII)
CY MAY 31-JUN 03, 1994
CL YOKOHAMA, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS, FDN ADV INT SCI
ID DEPENDENCE
AB AlGaAs double heterostructure laser diodes with grown optical window structure facets have been fabricated by single-step metalorganic chemical vapor deposition (MOCVD) growth on grooved substrates for the first time. We report a new technique which permits the simultaneous formation of optical feedback mirrors and a submicron-thick window region. [01 $$($) over bar 1]-oriented dovetail grooves on a GaAs(100) substrate were prepared by wet etching. The growth was carried out by atmospheric-pressure MOCVD. The resulting broad area laser diode with a 0.3 mu m thick window region has a threshold current and slope efficiency similar to that of a laser diode with conventional cleaved facets. The light output power versus current characteristics were improved.
RP MARUTANI, Y (reprint author), SONY CORP,RES CTR,HODOGAYA KU,174 FUJITSUKA CHO,YOKOHAMA,KANAGAWA 240,JAPAN.

AU SAKURAI, Y
   KOBAYASHI, T

AF SAKURAI, Y
   KOBAYASHI, T
   KANDA, K
TI HYPER-THERMAL NEUTRON-IRRADIATION FIELD FOR NEUTRON-CAPTURE THERAPY
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM
   INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS
LA English
DT Article
ID MEDICAL-RESEARCH REACTOR; BEAM
AB The utilization of hyper-thermal neutrons, which have an energy spectrum of a Maxwell distribution higher than the room temperature of 300 K, has been studied in order to improve the thermal neutron flux distribution in a living body for a deep-seated tumor in neutron capture therapy (NCT). Simulation calculations using MCNP-V3 were carried out in order to investigate the characteristics of the hyper-thermal neutron irradiation field. From the results of simulation calculations, the following were confirmed: (i) The irradiation field of the hyper-thermal neutrons is feasible by using some scattering materials with high temperature, such as Be, BeO, C, SiC and ZrH1.7. Especially, ZrH1.7 is thought to be the best material because of good characteristics of up-scattering for thermal neutrons. (ii) The ZrH1.7 of 1200 K yields the hyper-thermal neutrons of a Maxwell-like distribution at about 2000 K and the treatable depth is about 1.5 cm larger comparing with the irradiation of the thermal neutrons of 300 K. (iii) The contamination by the secondary gamma-rays from the scattering materials can be sufficiently eliminated to the tolerance level for NCT through the bismuth layer, without the larger change of the energy spectrum of hyper-thermal neutrons.
RP SAKURAI, Y (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV,INST RES REACTOR,KUMATORI,OSAKA 59004,JAPAN.
CR BRIESMEISTER JF, 1968, LA7936M
   BRUGGER RM, 1986, P WORKSHOP NEUTRON C, P83

TI Magnetic Relaxation of (La1-xSrx)(2)CuO4 Single Crystals with Various Sr
   Composition
SO PHYSICA C-SUPERCONDUCTIVITY AND ITS APPLICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
AB The magnetization curves of (La1-xSrx)(2)CuO4 single crystals a. re classified into two types. In the under-doped region (x < 0.075), magnetization dccrcases with power of the time, M(t) = M(0)t(-alpha). The current depended pinning potential, U = U0In(J(c)/J), explains this behavior. In the over-doped region (x >= 0.075), relaxation rate increases for increasing field and temperature at first. But there is a bump on B-T plane, whose position corresponds to the second peak.
C1 Univ Tokyo, Dept Ind Chem, Bunkyo Ku, Tokyo 113, Japan.
   Kyushu Univ, Dept Elect, Higashi Ku, Fukuoka 812, Japan.
RP Kobayashi, T (reprint author), Univ Tokyo, Dept Ind Chem, Bunkyo Ku, 7-3-1 Hongo, Tokyo 113, Japan.
CR FEIGELMAN MV, 1989, PHYS REV LETT, V63, P2303, DOI 10.1103/PhysRevLett.63.2303
   KIMURA T, 1992, PHYSICA C, V192, P247, DOI 10.1016/0921-4534(92)90767-7
   KOBAYASHI T, 1993, APPL PHYS LETT, V62, P1830, DOI 10.1063/1.109563
   Mawatari Y., 1993, THESIS KYISHU U
   ZELDOV E, 1990, APPL PHYS LETT, V56, P680, DOI 10.1063/1.103310
NR 5
TC 0
Z9 0

TI Neutron Fluence Dependence of Superconducting Properties and Crystal
   Structure on Bi2Sr2CaCu2Oy Single Crystal
SO PHYSICA C-SUPERCONDUCTIVITY AND ITS APPLICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
AB Single crystals of Bi2Sr2CaCu2Oy grown by floating zone method were irradiated with fast neutrons in the fluence range of 6x10(16) to 3x10(18) cm(-2). Critical temperature (T-c) showed little change below the fluence of 1x10(18) cm(-2), while T-c decreased to 65 K at 3x10(18) cm(-2). Significant increase in c-axis lattice constant was observed above 6x10(17) cm(-2). Critical current density (J(c)) was enhanced in the temperature range of 4.2 to 60 K below 1 x 10(18) cm(-2), while J(c) decreased at 3x10(18) cm(-2). The optimum fluence where J(c) had the maximum value was 2x10(17)-1x10(18) cm(-2), depending on temperature and magnetic field for measurement.
C1 Univ Tokyo, Dept Quantum Engn & Syst Sci, Tokyo 113, Japan.
   Univ Tokyo, Dept Appl Chem, Tokyo 113, Japan.
RP Kusagaya, K (reprint author), Univ Tokyo, Dept Quantum Engn & Syst Sci, 7-3-1 Hongo, Tokyo 113, Japan.
CR GERHAUSER W, 1991, PHYSICA C, V185, P2273, DOI 10.1016/0921-4534(91)91261-2
   KRITSCHA W, 1990, EUROPHYS LETT, V12, P179, DOI 10.1209/0295-5075/12/2/015
   NEUMULLER HW, 1990, J LESS-COMMON MET, V164, P1351, DOI 10.1016/0022-5088(90)90556-Y
   Shiraishi K., 1992, JPN J APPL PHYS.PT 1, V8A, pL1037
   TAKAMURA S, 1991, JPN J APPL PHYS 2, V30, pL18, DOI 10.1143/JJAP.30.L18

TI MEASUREMENTS OF THE INCLUSIVE BRANCHING RATIOS OF TAU-LEPTONS TO K-S(0)
   AND CHARGED K-ASTERISK(892)
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID DECAY; LEP; SYMMETRY; DETECTOR; LIBRARY; PROGRAM
AB We describe measurements of inclusive branching ratios of the tau lepton to K-S(0) and charged K*(892) using Z(0)-->tau(+)tau(-) candidates collected with the OPAL detector at LEP during 1990-1992. From a total of 61 854 tau candidates we find:
   Br(tau(-)-->K(S)(0)X(-)nu(tau))=0.97+/-0.09(stat.)+/-0.06(syst.)%
   Br(tau(-)-->K(*-)greater than or equal to 0h(0) nu(tau))=1.94+/-0.27(stat.)+/-0.15(syst.)%
   where X(-) refers to any configuration of particles with charge -1 and h(0) is any neutral hadron other than the K-S(0).

TI UPDATED MEASUREMENT OF THE TAU-LIFETIME
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID LEPTON LIFETIME; BRANCHING RATIO; DETECTOR; MASS; PROGRAM; DECAY
AB We present an update of our measurement of the tau lepton lifetime, using data taken during 1992 and 1993 with the OPAL detector at LEP.  The lifetime is determined from analyses of the impact parameters of tracks from tau decays to a single charged particle, and the reconstructed decay lengths from tau decays to three charged particls.  With the added statistics (which increase the tau pair event sample size by more than a factor of four over our 1990 and 1991 data sample), the updated lifetime measurement is:  tau(tau) = 288.8 +/- 2.2 (stat) +/- 1.4 (sys) fs.  When combined with world-average measurements of the tau leptonic branching fractions (assuming e-mu universality), the ratio of charged-current couplings is:  (g(tau)/g(mu)) = .005 +/- 0.007, in agreement with the hypothesis of tau-mu charged-current universality.
C1 UNIV BOLOGNA,DIPARTIMENTO FIS,I-40126 BOLOGNA,ITALY.

TI NOVEL IMIDAZOLES AND HYDANTOINS MODERATELY STRAINED BY INCORPORATION
   WITH 2-AZABICYCLO[2.2.1]HEPTENE SKELETON
SO BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID DIELS-ALDER REACTIONS; CYCLOCONDENSATION; SPECTROSCOPY; DERIVATIVES;
   ACID
AB The reactions of 3-acyl-2-azabicyclo[2.2.1]hept-5-enes with phenyl isocyanate, phenyl isothiocyanate, and ethoxycarbonyl isothiocyanate followed by cyclization reactions under basic conditions respectively provided a hydantoin, a thiohydantoin, and a 1,3-dihydro-2H-imidazole-2-thione incorporated with the azabicyclic skeleton. Treatment of the imidazolethione with Raney nickel gave a phenyl-substituted imidazole fused with 2-azabicyclo[2.2.1]hept-2-ene. The effect of annulation on the C-13 NMR of the imidazole ring is discussed.
RP KOBAYASHI, T (reprint author), SHINSHU UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT CHEM,MATSUMOTO,NAGANO 390,JAPAN.

AU LIAO, SH
   TORNG, T
   KOBAYASHI, T
AF LIAO, SH
   TORNG, T
   KOBAYASHI, T
TI STABILITY AND BIASING CHARACTERISTICS OF A PERMANENT-MAGNET BIASED
   SAL/MR DEVICE
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON MAGNETICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6th Joint Magnetism and Magnetic Materials-Intermag Conference
CY JUN 20-23, 1994
CL ALBUQUERQUE, NM
SP AMER INST PHYS, IEEE, MAGNET SOC, MINERALS MET & MAT SOC, AMER SOC TESTING & MAT, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, AMER CERAM SOC
ID EXCHANGE
AB A longitudinal bias field can be produced by exchange-coupling a soft ferromagnetic MR layer, such as NiFe with a permanent magnetic (PM) thin film. This exchange bias field creates a single domain state in the MR layer and thereby suppresses the Barkhausen noise. The center active region of an MR sensor could remain magnetically soft if only the end regions of the MR stripe are exchange coupled. A CoNiCr hard magnetic thin film is deposited on top of a Cr underlayer to achieve a high coercivity of 750 Oe. The exchange coupling effect between the CoNiCr and the NiFe is significantly enhanced after a 290 degrees C 3-hour annealing cycle. Unshielded Devices fabricated with the patterned hard bias scheme were found very stable and the biasing characteristics are quite different from those coupled with FeMn. The PM materials are generally less prone to corrosion and compared to FeMn and are more compatible with wafer and slider fabrication processes.
C1 HITACHI MET LTD,MAGNET & ELECTR MAT RES LAB,KUMAGAYA,SAITAMA 360,JAPAN.
RP LIAO, SH (reprint author), APPL MAGNET CORP,75 ROBIN HILL RD,GOLETA,CA 93117, USA.

   TORNG T, IN PRESS

TI NUMERICAL-ANALYSIS OF SENSITIVITY DISTRIBUTION FOR MR STRIPS STABILIZED
   BY PERMANENT-MAGNET FILMS
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON MAGNETICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6th Joint Magnetism and Magnetic Materials-Intermag Conference
CY JUN 20-23, 1994
CL ALBUQUERQUE, NM
SP AMER INST PHYS, IEEE, MAGNET SOC, MINERALS MET & MAT SOC, AMER SOC TESTING & MAT, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, AMER CERAM SOC
AB For the MR strips stabilized by the permanent magnet films, we numerically analyze the effects of the leakage field of the permanent magnet films on the bias angle in the MR films. Using the magnet films as the domain control films, magnetization rotation in the MR films at the track edges is suppressed by their leakage fields and will in turn decrease the effective track width. The decrease of the effective track width is thought to be due to the large leakage field especially at the track edges, so we examined some cases of decreasing the leakage field at track edges. Among the cases, the effective track width was most effectively enlarged when the distance between the magnet films was widened compared with the spacing of the leads.
RP KIKUCHI, K (reprint author), HITACHI MET LTD,MAGNET & ELECTR MAT RES LAB,MIKAJIRI 5200,KUMAGAYA,SAITAMA 360,JAPAN.

AU NAKAMOTO, T
   KOBAYASHI, T
AF NAKAMOTO, T
   KOBAYASHI, T
TI DEVELOPMENT OF CIRCUIT FOR MEASURING BOTH Q-VARIATION AND
   RESONANT-FREQUENCY SHIFT OF QUARTZ-CRYSTAL MICROBALANCE
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON ULTRASONICS FERROELECTRICS AND FREQUENCY CONTROL
LA English
DT Article
AB Although frequency shift is often used for QCM (Quartz Crystal Microbalance) measurement, Q of a resonator also varies when viscous loading occurs.  However, it is difficult to measure Q variation in real time in comparison with resonant frequency shift.  Furthermore, oscillation frequency shift deviates from real resonant one in case of large viscous loading.  Here, the authors have developed the circuit based upon motional admittance method for measuring both Q variation and real resonant frequency shift.  It was applied to a quartz-resonator gas sensor, and its Q variation was measured by this circuit.  Moreover, it was compared with a conventional oscillation circuit and the frequency shift of the former was remarkably different from that of the latter in case of large Q variation.  When a quartz resonator coated with PEG20M (PolyEthylene Glycol 20M) membrane was exposed to water vapor, its Q decreased from 38700 to 3650 and a frequency shift of the oscillation circuit was only about one sixth of this circuit.
RP NAKAMOTO, T (reprint author), TOKYO INST TECHNOL,DEPT ELECT & ELECTR ENGN,2-12-1 OOKAYAMA,MEGURO KU,TOKYO 152,JAPAN.

TI ONE-SHOT EXCIMER-LASER LAMINAR ANNEALING OF SRTIO3 THIN-FILMS IN SOLIDUS
   PHASE
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE SRTIO3; YBA2CU3OY; HETEROSTRUCTURE; EXCIMER LASER; LASER ANNEAL
ID DIELECTRIC-PROPERTIES; TEMPERATURE
AB By virtue of high optical absorptance and low thermal conductivity of SrTiO3, and short duration of the laser pulse, one-shot ArF excimer laser irradiation exerted an efficient annealing effect an the top SrTiO3 thin layer in the SrTiO3/YBa2Cu3Oy/MgO heterostructure without causing interfacial deterioration, Namely, our new method is characterized by laminar annealing of nanosecond duration, actually, by one-shot laser irradiation, the permittivity of the top SrTiO3 film (110 nm thick) was improved from 52 epsilon(0) (as grown) to 220 epsilon(0). Annealing strongly depended on the laser energy but not on the pulse number. When the laser energy was increased up to 150 mJ/cm(2), at which the top surface of the underlying YBa2Cu3Oy reached its molten phase, the SrTiO3 permittivity degraded markedly.
RP TAGA, M (reprint author), OSAKA UNIV,FAC ENGN SCI,1-3 MACHIKANEYAMA,TOYONAKA,OSAKA 560,JAPAN.

   FILMS
ID BULK ZNSE
AB All-optical photo-thermal bistabilities in the near infrared luminescence (800 nm) of a thin (5.5 mu m) spray-pyrolyzed CdS film are studied with the 514.5 nm line of an argon laser. We report the first observation of both dispersive and absorptive luminescence bistabilities in the same CdS film. The temperature dependence of the luminescence intensity and self-focusing are found to be the origins of absorptive and dispersive luminescence bistabilities, respectively. Furthermore, it is demonstrated that the shape of the bistable response of the luminescence depends crucially on the entrance slit width of the monochromator.
RP ULLRICH, B (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,HONGO 7-3-1,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI STRUCTURE FORMATION OF ORGANIC MULTILAYERS
SO MACROMOLECULAR SYMPOSIA
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Symposium on Polymer Science - Progress in Chemistry and
   Physics, Celebrating the 10th Anniversary of the
   Marx-Planck-Institute-for-Polymer-Research
CY MAY 26-27, 1994
CL MAINZ, GERMANY
SP MAX PLANCK INST POLYM RES
AB Interface structures of C60 and polymeric phthalocyanines (GeOPc and AlFPc) were analyzed by high resolution electron microscopy. C60 was crystallized making its {111}-plane parallel to the surface of tetragonal phthalocyanines as on other substrates. This may be due to strong tendency of C60 to make its closed-pack layer parallel to the surface during crystallization. In addition to this plane orientation, an axial orientation was observed; The [110] and [112] directions of C60 orient along the [110] directions of phthalocyanines. It can be concluded from observations that the lattice-matching between the corresponding repeating distances of C60 and phthalocyanines is an important factor governing the orientation.

TI A CASE-STUDY OF THE APPLICATION OF A MICROCOMPUTER-BASED FAVORABILITY
   EVALUATION SYSTEM - URANIUM EXPLORATION IN THE ALLIGATOR RIVERS URANIUM
   FIELD, NORTHERN-TERRITORY, AUSTRALIA
SO MATHEMATICAL GEOLOGY
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Session on Expert Systems and Artificial Intelligence in the Applied
   Geosciences, at the 29th International Geological Congress (IGC)
CY AUG 24-SEP 03, 1992
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
SP INT ASSOC MATH GEOL
DE DATA-DIRECTED NUMERICAL METHOD (DDM); URANIUM EXPLORATION; ALLIGATOR
   RIVERS URANIUM FIELD
ID DEPOSITS; MINERALIZATION; JABILUKA; ORIGIN; AGE
AB We have attempted to develop an expert system to evaluate the favorability of uranium exploration projects using the ''Data-directed Numerical Method (DdM).'' We developed the system for the Macintosh personal computer, so as to facilitate the iterative processes of trial and error inherent in the DdM. In a derailed case study, we use the above system to evaluate the favorability of the Alligator Rivers Uranium Field, Northern Territory, Australia. The favorability of the target area is evaluated by considering several exploration parameters related to the geological factors controlling ore formation. The selection of appropriate exploration parameters is important to tile success of the method. We then selected 15 model cells to validate each exploration parameter and also to design the exploration model by the application of tile chi-square rest. The result of the favorability evaluation, as displayed by the developed system, indicates that our designed exploration model is acceptable. By employing the above processes we conclude that the system using the DdM is applicable as an exploration tool and is useful in establishing an exploration model.
C1 PNC EXPLORAT AUSTRALIA PTY LTD,PERTH,WA,AUSTRALIA.

AU KOBAYASHI, T

TI EVALUATION OF STATIC AND DYNAMIC FRACTURE-TOUGHNESS IN DUCTILE CAST-IRON
SO METALLURGICAL AND MATERIALS TRANSACTIONS A-PHYSICAL METALLURGY AND
   MATERIALS SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article
ID INSTRUMENTED CHARPY-TEST; SYSTEM
AB Crack extension behavior and fracture toughness of ductile cast iron were examined by three-point bend tests, where various detection methods of crack initiation under static and dynamic loading conditions were adopted. Loading on the specimens was interrupted at various displacement points, and the final fracture surfaces of the Specimen were observed via scanning electron microscopy (SEM). Crack-tip opening displacement (CTOD) obtained under the dynamic loading condition was smaller than that under the static loading condition in ferritic ductile cast iron, and CTOD additionally decreased with increasing pearlite content in the matrix. The relationship between J(Delta C) obtained by the compliance changing rate method and J(R) established by the intersection of the crack extension resistance curve and the theoretical blunting line varied with pearlite content. The average value of J(Delta C) and J(R), that is J(mid), was proposed to define the fracture toughness of ductile cast iron; J(mid) was considered to be a reasonable measure for the fracture toughness of ductile cast iron, irrespective of loading condition and the pearlite content in the matrix.
RP KOBAYASHI, T (reprint author), TOYOHASHI UNIV TECHNOL,DEPT PROD SYST ENGN,TOYOHASHI,AICHI 441,JAPAN.

TI POSSIBLE APPLICATION OF PXR TO THE BEAM-DIVERGENCE MEASUREMENTS
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS
   SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
LA English
DT Article
ID CRYSTAL; SCATTERING; ELECTRONS; RADIATION
AB The effect of the beam divergence on the parametric X-radiation has been experimentally investigated at NPI, Tomsk, and at INS, Tokyo for the electron energies 600 and 800 MeV, respectively.  It has been shown that the crystal-orientation dependence of PXR is sensitive to the beam divergence, suggesting that PXR can offer a simple means for determining the angular divergence of high energy charged particle beams.

TI MAGNETIC-FIELD DEPENDENCE OF OPTICAL-ABSORPTION IN SI NANOCRYSTALLITES -
   A QUANTUM-SIZE EFFECT
SO SOLID STATE COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
DE NANOSTRUCTURES, SEMICONDUCTORS; OPTICAL PROPERTIES; LIGHT ABSORPTION AND
   REFLECTION
ID SEMICONDUCTOR MICROCRYSTALLITES; CONFINEMENT; SILICON;
   PHOTOLUMINESCENCE; DOTS
AB The Zeeman splittings of the quantum confined states are observed in nanocrystalline Si films by the magnetic circular dichroism (MCD) measurement. The MCD signals with the largest intensity are due to the states at 2.8 - 3.1 eV. The shifts of the observed peak positions in the MCD signals to higher energy with reduction in the size of nanocrystallites suggest that the shifts are due to the quantum size effect. The states at 2.8 - 3.1 eV are due to direct transitions in Si nanocrystallites, which is consistent with the luminescence of nanocrystalline Si.

TI DISTRIBUTION OF SPIN-ISOSPIN STRENGTHS IN B-12 AND B-13
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article
DE NUCLEAR REACTIONS C-12,C-13(GAMMA, PI(+)); E=191 MEV; MEASURED
   SIGMA(E(PI),THETA(PI)); DEDUCED PHOTOPION PRODUCTION SIGMA(THETA(PI))
   AND SIGMA(E(PI)); NATURAL C-12 AND ENRICHED C-13 TARGETS; TAGGED PHOTON
   BEAM; B-12,B-13 DEDUCED LEVELS
ID INELASTIC ELECTRON-SCATTERING; PION-PHOTOPRODUCTION; ANALOG STATES;
   LIGHT-NUCLEI; C-12; TRANSITIONS; ELECTROPRODUCTION; EXCITATIONS;
   RESONANCES; PI-,GAMMA
AB The differential cross sections of the reactions C-12,C-13(gamma, pi(+))B-12,B-13 were measured using tagged photons at the mean energy E(gamma) = 191 MeV at five angles 35 degrees less than or equal to theta(pi) less than or equal to 145 degrees corresponding to the momentum transfer to the nucleus 0.5 less than or equal to q less than or equal to 1.5 fm(-1). The major transition strengths leading to various excited states in B-12,B-13, in, both cases, are concentrated within a resonance centered at about 7 MeV excitation energy in B-12,B-13 (about 22 MeV in C-12,C-13) with a full width at half maximum (FWHM) of about 12 MeV, reminiscent of the well-known electric-dipole gian resonances. The two reactions are compared in the context of the weak-coupling model.

TI SEARCH FOR RARE HADRONIC B-DECAYS
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID MESON DECAYS; TOP-QUARK; DETECTOR; QCD
AB A search for rare decays of B hadrons has been performed using approximately two million hadronic Z0 decays collected by the OPAL experiment between 1990 and 1993.  The exclusive decay channels B(d)0 --> pi+pi-, B(d)0 --> K+pi-, B(s)0 --> pi+ K- and B(s)0 --> K+K- have been studied.  Such decays include contributions from flavour changing neutral current processes such as hadronic penguin decays.  No significant excess of events has been observed in the pi+pi-, pi+K- and K+K- invariant mass distributions.  Consequently, upper limits on the B(d)0 branching ratios,
   Br(B(d)0 --> pi+pi-) < 4.7 x 10(-5) and Br(B(d)0 --> K+pi-) < 8.1 x 10(-5),
   and on the B(s)0 branching ratios,
   Br(B(s)0 --> pi+K-) < 2.6 x 10(-4) and Br(B(s)0 --> K+K-) < 1.4 x 10(-4),
   have been set at the 90% confidence level.  These limits assume that the ratio of the partial decay widths of the Z0, GAMMA(Z0 --> bbBAR)/GAMMA(Z0 --> hadrons), is 0.217 and that the fractions of B(d)0 and B(s)0 mesons produced during fragmentation are 39.5% and 12% respectively.  The B(s)0 branching ratio limits are the first such limits obtained.
C1 UNIV BIRMINGHAM,SCH PHYS & SPACE RES,BIRMINGHAM B15 2TT,W MIDLANDS,ENGLAND.

AU TAKASAKI, N
   MURATA, S
   SAITOH, M
   KOBAYASHI, T
   PARK, L
   OKADA, N
AF TAKASAKI, N
   MURATA, S
   SAITOH, M
   KOBAYASHI, T
   PARK, L
   OKADA, N
TI SPECIES-SPECIFIC AMPLIFICATION OF TRANSFER-RNA-DERIVED SHORT
   INTERSPERSED REPETITIVE ELEMENTS (SINES) BY RETROPOSITION - A PROCESS OF
   PARASITIZATION OF ENTIRE GENOMES DURING THE EVOLUTION OF SALMONIDS
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE NATIONAL ACADEMY OF SCIENCES OF THE UNITED STATES OF
   AMERICA
LA English
DT Article
DE RETROPOSON; SALMON; PHYLOGENY
ID ALU FAMILY; SUBFAMILY RELATIONSHIPS; REPEATED SEQUENCES; SUCCESSIVE
   WAVES; LINEAGE HISTORY; DNA-SEQUENCE; SOURCE GENES; RNA; PSEUDOGENES;
   DIVERGENCE
AB Fourteen members of the Hpa I subfamilies of tRNA-derived SINEs in particular salmonid species were isolated from genomic libraries of chum salmon, kokanee, coho salmon, masu salmon, and steelhead. Alignment of the sequences of these 14 members, together with those of 4 members already published, 3 of which were previously demonstrated to have been amplified specifically in certain lineages, revealed the presence of five subfamilies with particular diagnostic nucleotides. The amplification of members of the same subfamily in different salmonid lineages and the amplification of members of different subfamilies in the same salmonid lineage suggest that multiple dispersed loci were responsible for amplification or, alternatively, that SINEs were transmitted horizontally between species. These two possibilities are not mutually exclusive. Our results also indicate that the Hpa I SINEs in salmonids behave like parasites. The amplification of these SINEs is ongoing and continues to shape the evolution of salmonid genomes.
C1 TOKYO INST TECHNOL,FAC BIOSCI & BIOTECHNOL,MIDORI KU,YOKOHAMA,KANAGAWA 227,JAPAN.
   NATL RES INST AQUACULTURE,TAMAKI,MIE 51904,JAPAN.
   NOAA,NATL MARINE FISHERIES SERV,NW FISHERIES SCI CTR,DIV COASTAL ZONE & ESTUARINE STUDIES,SEATTLE,WA 98112.

TI OBSERVATION OF EXCLUSIVE DECAYS OF B-MESONS AT LEP
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID OPAL JET CHAMBER; Z(0) DECAYS; LIFETIME; DETECTOR;
   GAMMA(Z(0)->B(B)OVER-BAR)/GAMMA(Z(0)->HADRONS); HADRONS; LEPTONS; CHARM
AB Data collected with the OPAL detector at LEP during 1990-1992 are used to study exclusive decays of B mesons. We observe the decay B-d(0) --> D(*-)pi(+) and several B-s(0) candidates in the modes B-s(0) --> J/psi phi and B-s(0) --> D(s)(-)pi(+). Using one unambiguous event in the mode B-s(0) --> J/psi phi, we measure the mass of the B-s(0) meson to be 5.359 +/- 0.019 +/- 0.007 GeV/c(2).

TI SEARCH FOR A SCALAR TOP-QUARK USING THE OPAL DETECTOR
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID LUND MONTE-CARLO; SUPERSYMMETRIC PARTICLES; Z0 DECAYS; E+E ANNIHILATION;
   MASS LIMITS; JET FRAGMENTATION; SUSY PARTICLES; COLLISIONS; COLLIDER;
   LEPTONS
AB A search for a supersymmetric partner of the top quark (($) over tilde t(1)) has been performed by the OPAL experiment in e(+)e(-) collisions at LEP. The integrated luminosity of the data sample analysed was 69.1 pb(-1), which corresponds to 1.68 x 10(6) produced Z(0) --> q ($) over tilde q events. No ($) over tilde t(1) candidates have been found. This study excludes the existence of the ($) over tilde t(1) with a mass below 45.1 GeV at 95% C.L., where the mixing angle of left- and right-handed partners is smaller than 0.85 rad or greater than 1.15 rad, and the mass difference between the ($) over tilde t(1) and the lightest neutralino is greater than 5 GeV.

TI MASS YIELD AND ANGULAR-DISTRIBUTION OF RARE-EARTH ELEMENTS PRODUCED IN
   PROTON-INDUCED FISSION OF PU-244
SO JOURNAL OF ALLOYS AND COMPOUNDS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Actinides
CY SEP 19-24, 1993
CL SANTE FE, NM
SP LOS ALAMOS NATL LAB, GTS INST TRANSACTINIUM SCI, INT SCI FDN, INT ATOMIC ENERGY AGCY, LAWRENCE LIVERMORE NATL LAB, US DOE
AB In the fission system Pu-244+p, formation cross sections of rare earth products were observed in the proton energy range 10 to 16 MeV, and their angular distributions were measured in detail of proton energy of 15 MeV. The highest mass number of rare earth products was 162 which corresponded to a highly asymmetric mass division of A(H)/A(L) approximate to 2. The incident energy dependence and angular anisotropies of rare earth products were found to be the same, even for highly asymmetric mass division, and no clear evidence was observed for the effect of neutron numbers 50 and 97 on cross section and angular anisotropy. These observations lead to the conclusion that the fission process, leading to highly asymmetric mass division, experiences the same saddle point in the course of deformation toward scission as that for other typical asymmetric mass division.
C1 TOKYO METROPOLITAN UNIV,FAC SCI,HACHIOJI 19203,TOKYO,JAPAN.

TI SCANNING TUNNELING MICROSCOPE CONTRAST OF
   PERYLENE-3,4,9,10-TETRACARBOXYLIC-DIANHYDRIDE ON GRAPHITE AND ITS
   APPLICATION TO THE STUDY OF EPITAXY
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID CONTACT BARRIER DIODES; ORGANIC THIN-FILMS; STM IMAGES;
   COPPER-PHTHALOCYANINE; MOLECULES; GROWTH; DIANHYDRIDE; DEPENDENCE;
   MECHANISM; CRYSTALS
AB Epitaxial films of perylene-3,4,9,10-tetracarboxylic-dianhydride (PTCDA) on graphite (0001) were investigated by scanning tunneling microscopy.  Molecular image contrast of PTCDA was found to depend strongly upon the molecular orientation and the position on graphite.  In particular, the periodic discrepancy between PTCDA and graphite lattice points results in a modulation of contrast, which can be used to determine the epitaxial relation of PTCDA relative to the substrate accurately.  By analyzing this modulation of contrast, we determined two kinds of epitaxial orientation of PTCDA.  These orientations have no exact commensurate relation with graphite, but every lattice point of PTCDA lies on a lattice line parallel to the a axis (or b axis) of graphite.  This specific feature contributes to decreasing the interfacial energy.  The contrast mechanism of adsorbed molecules is also discussed.
RP HOSHINO, A (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV,INST CHEM RES,UJI,KYOTO 611,JAPAN.
